oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and structural characterisation of a new mu(2)-Te bridged complex of molybdenum with oxo and imido ligands
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MATHUR, P
GHOSE, S
HOSSAIN, MM
VAHRENKAMP, H
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: crystal-structure

dinuclear
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reflux of a benzene solution of Cp2Mo2Fe2(CO)(7)Te-2 and PhN3 in the presence of air afforded the new compound CP2Mo2O2(mu-Te)(mu-NC6H5) in 33% yield. It was characterised by IR and H-1 and Te-125 NMR. spectroscopy. Crystallographic analysis established its structure. The structure can be described as consisting of a CpMo-MoCp unit, bridged by a mu-Te atom and an imido ligand. Also bonded lo each Mo atom is a terminally bonded oxo group.
